Content:: Carla Cassola (15 December 1947 – 22 July 2022)[1] was an Italian actress, voice actress and composer. Born in Taormina, Messina, before starting her acting career Cassola studied singing, piano and guitar .[2] Active on stage, in films and on television, she taught acting in various institutions, including the Centre universitaire in Nancy.[2] Cassola was also a voice actress and has won a Silver Ribbon for the dubbing of Tilda Swinton in Orlando.[2][3] She was also a composer of Incidental music for stage works.[2]  This article about an Italian actor or actress is a stub. You can help Wikipedia by expanding it.
